title: & in expresions
description:
### In all computers, memory is stored as a list of adresses.
In C++ you can access these with the "Adress of" operator, &. You puy & before a variable, and it returns the position of it in memory, which is the memory **_Adress_**. 

The CBit OS team wants to check that their operating system doesn't manage to fail at storing memory adresses.

You must fix the code so it outputs the adress of x insteado f x. _We will cover more on memory in the future._
